body: You're hiding, shadowing, bridging some methods, do you? Might want to check https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/333#issuecomment-285399782 -- which was re-opend only hours ago.

issue.title: Inheriting nested tests

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Adds a failing test demonstrating the missing inheritance of nested test classes as described in #717.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

---

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [ ] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [ ] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [ ] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests)
- [ ] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/meta/API.html)
- [ ] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [ ] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

body: You do not seem to show my use case - have a look at #718, which creates a test demonstrating my problem.
I see. Thanks for the [failing](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/marcphilipp/junit5/build/732) test case.

I think my use case is a typical example of testing interface implementations:

1. create an interface `Awesome` 
2. create an abstract test class `AwesomeTest`, which tests the correct behavior as defined by `Awesome`'s Javadoc
3. for each implementation of `Awesome`, create a matching implementation of `AwesomeTest`

Up to here all is fine and everything works as planned. Implementations of `AwesomeTest` inherit all tests methods so all of them get executed. Now, the maintainer of `AwesomeTest` does some refactoring and decides to reorganize tests in nested classes. ~> Doesn't work because these do not get inherited.

Hence my opinion that they should be inherited.
Oh, too slow, you already added the _bug_ label, so I assume you agree. :wink:
I do. Let's wait what @junit-team/junit-lambda thinks about that.

I would also expect it and would be surprised to see nested class tests not being run (being 'inherited').

What I would like to point out though is that we need to be careful using the term '**inherited**'. Inheritance implies a semantic model that nested classes are not part of.

issue.title: Include "inherited" nested classes in findNestedClasses()

milestone.title: 5.0 M4
milestone.description: Themes: test templates, repeated tests, and parameterized tests.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Fixes #717 by traversing superclasses to find all declared classes in the hierarchy of the class to scan. Declared classes of implemented (super-) interfaces are also included.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests)
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/meta/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

body:
@nicolaiparlog I didn't manage to pull/fetch/cherry/fetch/pick your #718 into my branch. So, I copied your tests over manually. Hope, you don't mind.

Does #722 work as you expect it work? @sbrannen et al will take a look at this issue and PR later.

@jlink and @bechte, as "nested test class" aficionados, what are your thoughts on this topic?

Does the proposed change _violate_ the principles of nested test classes in terms of scoping, semantics, etc.?
